intro: Tabebuia obscura var. schultesiana, commonly known as the Schultesian trumpet tree, is a species of flowering tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a dense canopy with elliptical, dark green leaves. Its bark is often smooth and may exude a milky sap when wounded. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
